byline.original: By NICOLA CLARK and DAN BILEFSKY

abstract: Cockpit voice recorder from Germanwings flight that crashed into the French Alps, killing all 150 people on board, indicates that one pilot was shut out of cockpit before plane's descent; investigators say pounding on door is heard, as well as other sounds and voices, but pilot at helm of plane did not respond; unanswered questions remain as to lack of communication between pilots.
lead_paragraph: As officials struggled to explain why a jet with 150 people on board crashed, an investigator said evidence indicated that one pilot left the cockpit and was unable to get back in.

headline.main: Germanwings Pilot Was Locked Out of Cockpit Before Crash in France
headline.print_headline: One Pilot Locked Out of Cockpit Before Crash

snippet: As officials struggled to explain why a jet with 150 people on board crashed, an investigator said evidence indicated that one pilot left the cockpit and was unable to get back in.
